results.brief_description:
An edited excerpt from “Alpine Playground ” (1962)
produced by Cinesound/Tourist Development Authority of Victoria. The original full length title is held on 16mm in the ACMI collection.

results.title: Headskin
results.brief_description: Layers of identity and expression exposed through the often raw and violent process of intercultural dialogue reveal a universal vulnerability.
results.description: Layers of identity and expression exposed through the often raw and violent process of intercultural dialogue reveal a universal vulnerability.

results.title: Memories: a short walk with Aunty Maude
results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about the childhood and life of Aunty Maude Alberts, a Gundijimara Elder and the filmmaker’s grandmother. With her children and grandchildren Aunty Maude visits “the old place”, a property outside of Heywood where she grew up. The film makes a poetic exploration of Aunty Maude’s upbringing and the passing on of her traditional knowledge to her children and grandchildren.
results.title_for_label: Memories: a short walk with Aunty Maude

results.title: My shadow
results.brief_description:
Flat tyres, mystery calls. Cathy is being watched. Someone is following her, close as a shadow. Cathy tells her best friend. Heath already knows. The phone rings through the night. Is anyone listening?
A beautifully hand-drawn 2D animated narrative which captures the sense of frustration and fear when your life appears threatened by an unknown stalker and no-one out there is listening to your cries for help.

results.title: The Sacrifice
results.brief_description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.
